main event: A graduate student at the University of Virginia observed a bright white light moving in a straight line, making a sharp turn, and then moving at a much faster speed westward in Charlottesville, Virginia on October 6, 1962.
interesting points: The object appeared as bright as Sirius, but slightly yellower in color.
The object moved toward the Lacerta constellation above the North Star, then made a sharp turn and moved westward at a much faster speed.
The object appeared as a point source of light even at maximum magnification through binoculars, suggesting it was a distant object.
The object stopped and remained stationary for about 30 seconds before moving behind some trees.
The observer was unable to explain the phenomenon and included a rough map of the object's path in the sky.
sighted object: bright white light moving in the sky
witnesses: graduate student at the University of Virginia
